I recommend this game because as a survivor, it sometimes can get your heart racing and if you love that thrill then you'll likely have fun with it. As a killer, I love the hunting of the survivors and something about that is perfect in this game.
I will now go into the annoying parts about this game, as a killer, it takes quite a while just to try and get into a match, also for the killers, the devs have a habit of nerfing characters too much but leaving some killers in the very strong category barely even touching them. Some killers will camp hooks as well making it almost impossible to get off said hook.
Otherwise I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who would look past these flaws and would enjoy the hunt or the thrill of surviving

Dadurch wird das "Genrusher" Problem verringert aber nicht komplett gefixt. Ich denke aber auch dass es nicht m√∂glich ist das Problem zu beheben ohne dass es f√ºr Anf√§nger weniger Spa√ü macht. Es ist schade dass die Community unfassbar "Toxic" ist, aber man kann sich an das nervige "geklicke" von Taschenlampen und T-bagging an Paletten gew√∂hnen. Das die Godloops entfernt wurden ist wirklich "God"like. I've bought this game at least 3 times now and I keep coming back to it.  Does it have flaws? Lord yes.  But it does not mean the game isn't amazing.   If they added additional game modes it would probably be one of the most popular games on Steam, but as it stands, it's still a solid multiplayer experience and a good addition to any fan of horror.

Wanna buy a F2P game but at full cost (and also like 20 DLCs to get any semblance of fun?)
Then DBD is for you!

This game is, by it's nature, extremely frustrating. The survivors are toxic and the killers can be as well (when not getting bullied by toxic survivors) but it is all worth it in the end. 
At first blush, it would seem that a killer in the woods would have the upper hand when trying to kill 4 survivors - but,even though the survivors can not 'fight' back, it is never that easy. Furthermore, the "win" for survivors is not necessarily escaping the trial without being killed - though it feels that way. There are ways to distract, be altruistic, and even sacrifice one's self to gain more points than if one were to simply escape.
I say, if you like asymmetrical games and if you like the horror genre with elements of cooperation - this is a brilliant game. 

Note: 
1. play with good headphones... especially as the killer. Hearing, often times, is superior to seeing in the dense fog of the trials.  
2. if you can, play with friends when you survive - otherwise, you will die badly and often. even if you just have ONE friend, it gets much easier.
3. Don't be toxic - it just adds to the shittiness of the community.
soo far this game i fun i see it can be boring after a month but soo far fun
